multiplechoiceresponse.p:
Examine this argument:
Ed is walking the twelve miles to downtown. He just left five minutes ago. He walks at an ordinary pace. Therefore, probably he has not arrived yet.
multiplechoiceresponse.label: Does this inductive argument seem to be strong or weak?

div.p: This might seem to be deductive since even the fastest recorded runner could only cover a little over 1 mile in 5 minutes. The reason it is inductive is because Ed could have hopped in a cab or hitched a ride with a friend. We have good reason to believe he walked but it's not certain.
